criteria.title: Clear Purpose
criteria.short: Does the ordinance clearly state its purpose?
criteria.description: The ordinance should begin with a clear purpose section describing the problem it addresses and the objectives sought.

criteria.title: Definitions
criteria.description: Key terms used throughout the ordinance should be defined in a definitions section to reduce ambiguity.

criteria.title: Scope & Applicability
criteria.description: The ordinance should clearly state the scope, including geographic applicability, covered activities, and any exceptions or exemptions.

criteria.title: Enforcement & Penalties
criteria.short: Are enforcement mechanisms and penalties specified?
criteria.description: There should be clear enforcement provisions, including responsible agencies, procedures, fines, penalties, or remedies for non-compliance.

criteria.title: Compliance Timeline / Effective Date
criteria.short: When does it take effect and are there compliance timelines?
criteria.description: The ordinance should have an effective date and any deadlines or grace periods for compliance.

criteria.title: Public Notice & Participation
criteria.short: Does it reference public hearings or notice?
criteria.description: Consider whether the ordinance describes requirements for public notice, hearings, or opportunities for public participation.

criteria.title: Fiscal Impact
criteria.short: Is cost or fiscal impact described?
criteria.description: A high-quality ordinance will consider and, if appropriate, describe fiscal impacts, funding sources, or budgeting implications.

criteria.title: Reporting & Recordkeeping
criteria.description: The ordinance may require reporting, recordkeeping, or monitoring; these requirements should be explicit when applicable.

criteria.title: Severability & Conflicts
criteria.description: There should be a severability clause and direction on how conflicts with other laws are handled.
